TopicTitle: The one thing that really grinds your gears.

Articles.Content:
When people at my school are all like: "What are thoooooooooose?!" THEY'RE SHOES, OK? If I had the capacity to scream at 1000 dB..... *shakes fist at people at my school*

Edited January 15, 2016 by UnionPacific1983WP

Writing this: 

void thing()
{



}

As opposed to this: 

void thing() {



}

For some reason, that opening bracket MUST be on the same line, or it bothers me...

People saying 'Indian' when they mean 'Native North American'.

Unwanted/Unwelcome body contact from people of either gender.

Kid characters in movies who overuse 'Mommy' or 'Daddy'.

Conceptual artists. The kind who put a blank canvas in a museum and say they're exploring the meaning of a painting. Yeah that's a load of crap. You're getting rich for properly treating a canvas and you know it. As long as you never do that it won't bother me.

Sleepies/Eye boogers/The crud in your eyes in the morning.

Software updates that make no noticeable change in the software but take forever to install for some reason.

Ice on your windshield in the morning. (Anyone who lives above the 45th parallel knows this pain).

Mosquitoes.

Acne/Zits.

When there is one long post in a string of very short answers.

Irony.

Edited January 21, 2016 by Kuansenhama

When people assume/say I know everything just because I'm smart. [rant]I HAVE NO IDEA HOW MANY ELECTRONS ARE IN YOU, THEREFORE I DON'T KNOW EVERYTHING. IN FACT, I KNOW ALMOST NOTHING IF YOU LOOK AT EVERYTHING![/rant]

Excessive quantities of homework, too. 

Also, when my things are put in the wrong place. That's actually probably the most annoying one in this list.

Also, when people call a pyraminx a triangle, when triangles don't technically exist in our universe. Other scientific inconsistencies also bother me, although people start getting mad at you if you call them all out so I just take note of them in my head.

You know what grinds my gears? When someone say that Space exploration is useless at the same time they're using technology that would otherwise be impossible/unlikely without Space exploration.

Or really, anyone who generally dislikes Space exploration.

4 hours ago, Kuansenhama said:

Software updates that make no noticeable change in the software but take forever to install for some reason.

I know, right! I HATE that!
Easily manipulated people, they always end up turning on me from outside influence.

21 hours ago, Kuansenhama said:

Software updates that make no noticeable change in the software but take forever to install for some reason.

That likely means security or performance updates.
The fact that "literally" now apparently means "an intensifier." Oxford Dictionary, I hate you!
My brothers not caring about ksp.
